2054.subject: HPWE
2054.descrlong: A participative and lecture course with usage of videos and learning team discussions, nutritional experiential labs combined with student-driven presentations. Developed to not only present content, but to have students seriously look at nutrition and activity patterns to set action steps to improve eating choices. A baseline medical lab screen will be offered to all students enrolling in the course at the beginning and end of the semester. Credit/No Credit option. Letter grade required for Health and Wellness minors. (Offered fall semester.)

2064.subject: HPWE
2064.descrlong: Includes team discussions, nutritional experiential labs combined with student-driven presentations. Presents scientific nutritional content, seriously looking at nutrition and activity patterns to improve eating choices and assist others.  Examines special topics and nutritional needs in different ages, activity levels, or cultures.  May offer a baseline medical lab screen at the beginning and end of the semester, free of charge.  Credit/ No credit option.  Letter grade required for Health and Wellness minors. (Offered fall semester.)
